question: 222 Squadron, the first Sukhoi-30 MKI equipped squadron is to operate from the Thanjavur Air Force Station, of which southern state?
explanation:
The Indian Air Forceâ€™s (IAF) 222 Squadron with its Sukhoi-30 MKI (Su-30 MKI) fighters will be the part of Southern Air command and it will operate from the Thanjavur Air Force Station (AFS) in Tamil Nadu.
The Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh is to inaugurate the Induction ceremony of the Squadron from the air force station. Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) made the mechanical and electrical modifications on the fighter aircraft while the Indian Air Force developed the software of the Su-30 MKI squadron. This will enable the aircraft to carry 2.5 tonne Cruise missile BrahMos.
